author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Thanksgiving Turkeys, Olympic Flame Rehearsal, Explosion in Pakistan

author: Jackson Richman
description: The president said in an interview that he would classify the Muslim Brotherhood as a terrorist organization.
title: Trump Orders Designation of Muslim Brotherhood Chapters as Foreign Terrorist Groups

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Flights at Calgary International Airport have resumed after the airport temporarily paused operations on Nov. 24 due to heavy snowfall on the runway. Flight operations resumed at 9 a.m. MST on Nov. 24 after they were temporarily paused for just over an hour due to “heavy and accumulating snowfall on the airfield,” a Calgary International […]
title: Flights Resume at Calgary Airport After Temporary Pause Due to Heavy Snow

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Barrett will seek tougher cooperation from overseas police chiefs and expand Pacific crime-prevention efforts.
title: Illicit Tobacco and Hate Groups to Top AFP Chief’s INTERPOL Agenda

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Canadian opposition parties have stressed the importance of the prime minister maintaining regular talks with the U.S. president, after Prime Minister Mark Carney dismissed a reporter’s question about when he last spoke with U.S. President Donald Trump. Carney made the comment while attending the G20 Leaders’ Summit in Johannesburg, South Africa, on Nov. 23, while […]
title: Carney’s ‘Who Cares’ Remark on Trump Call Draws Opposition Pushback

author: The Canadian Press
description: Ottawa is not planning to set up an independent body to scrutinize the new capital framework in its budget, despite calls for more transparency from the government’s fiscal watchdog. Interim parliamentary budget officer Jason Jacques told MPs on the House of Commons finance committee Monday that he fears the changes made to the federal government’s […]
title: Budget Watchdog Calls for More Transparency After Liberals Shift Fiscal Anchors

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: A Canada-wide recall has been issued for more than 14,000 laser pointers sold online due to concerns that they may lead to permanent eye damage. Health Canada has issued a recall for the Gniby rechargeable green tactical flashlight, which also functions as a green laser pointer, after 14,744 units of the affected product were sold […]
title: Health Canada Warns Flashlight and Laser Pointer Sold on Amazon May Cause Permanent Eye Injuries

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: The Ontario government has announced plans to table legislation that would require those accused of a crime and granted bail to make an upfront cash security deposit instead of allowing them to pay later if they violate the terms of their release. Attorney General Doug Downey said during a Nov. 24 press conference that the […]
title: Ontario Proposes Upfront Cash Bail Under Proposed Justice Legislation

author: Bill Pan
description: Washington has weighed possible military engagement and economic sanctions to pressure Nigeria to do more to protect its Christian population.
title: US Ready to Deepen Cooperation With Nigeria to Stem Attacks on Christians

author: Noé Chartier
description: Before meeting with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi last weekend, Prime Minister Mark Carney said rebuilding ties with India will help diversify supply chains away from China in the field of renewable energy. “India is one of the leading developers of clean technology, particularly in solar and wind,” Carney told reporters in South Africa on […]
title: Carney Says India Can Help Diversify Supply Chains Away From China

author: The Canadian Press
description: One of four accused in an alleged anti-government plot to forcibly take control of land in the Quebec City area appeared briefly in court today and will return before a judge in the new year. Prosecutor Gabriel Lapierre told the Quebec court that the Crown has so far presented about 90 percent of the evidence […]
title: 1 of 4 Accused in Alleged Quebec Extremist Plot Appears in Court, to Return Next Year

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Public Safety Minister Gary Anandasangaree says the Liberal government’s gun buyback program will soon be launched across Canada following an initial pilot project in Nova Scotia. “I will be showing our next steps on the program as we roll out throughout the country. But it is significant to say that we will be rolling the […]
title: Federal Gun Buyback Program to Be Rolled out Across Canada After Nova Scotia Pilot

author: Victoria Friedman
description: Australia became the first country in the world to pass legislation on a social media ban for children, which will come into effect on Dec. 10.
title: Malaysia to Follow Australia With Social Media Ban for Children Under 16

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: U.S. envoy Massad Boulos has urged swift agreement on a humanitarian truce in Sudan.
title: Sudanese Top General Rejects US-Backed Cease-Fire Plan

author: The Canadian Press
description: The federal government has announced more than $35 million over three years to train dental students across the country. Health Minister Marjorie Michel made the announcement today in Montreal with Carlos Leitão, Liberal MP and former Quebec finance minister. A news release says the funding will go toward 30 oral health programs mainly at universities […]
title: Ottawa Announces $35 Million for 30 Oral Health Training Programs Across Canada

author: Ryan Morgan
description: Cartel de Los Soles—or Cartel of the Suns—is an alleged criminal enterprise that the United State says is linked to the Venezuelan government.
title: US Designates Cartel de Los Soles as Foreign Terrorist Organization

author: Epoch Video
description: A news conference is held after trade talks on China and tariffs in Brussels at 9:30 a.m. ET on Nov. 24.
title: REPLAY: Officials Hold News Conference After EU Trade Talks on China and Tariffs

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Winnipeg is asking its residents to put on their thinking caps and suggest names for the city’s snowplows. The city launched its Name that Plow! competition on Nov. 20 in a bid to provide names for 12 loaders and grading machines operated by the city. “The loaders and graders are part of a hardworking group […]
title: Name That Plow: Winnipeggers Asked to Name City’s Snowplow Fleet

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: More than 40 senators are calling on the federal government to impose a ban on sports betting advertisements in Canada. A letter addressed to the Prime Minister Mark Carney from Charlottetown Sen. Percy Downe and Waterloo, Ont. Sen. Marty Deacon asks Ottawa to instruct the Canadian Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission (CRTC) to prohibit all advertisements […]
title: Senators Urge Carney to Ban Sports Betting Ads

author: Epoch Video
description: The UK Parliament Culture, Media and Sport Committee holds a formal oral evidence session on the BBC’s processes of ensuring compliance with editorial guidelines and standards at 10:30 a.m. ET on Nov. 24.
title: LIVE NOW: UK Parliament Committee Holds Session on ‘The Work of the BBC’

author: Zachary Stieber
description: The trial compared the experimental vaccine to a licensed shot.
title: Pfizer’s mRNA Influenza Vaccine Does Better Than Standard Flu Shot in Trial

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Under the U.S.–EU trade deal, agreed in summer, 50 percent American steel tariffs remain in place.
title: No Deal Expected on US Steel Tariffs as EU Meets US Officials, Sefcovic Says

author: Victoria Friedman
description: White House spokeswoman Anna Kelly said South African President Cyril Ramaphosa was 'refusing to facilitate a smooth transition of the G20 presidency.'
title: US Says South Africa ‘Weaponized’ G20 Leadership After Summit Adopts Declaration

author: Guy Birchall
description: European leaders are meeting in person and via video link on the sidelines of a EU-African Union summit in Luanda, Angola.
title: EU Leaders Meet to Discuss Ukraine Peace Plan

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Senate President Sue Lines suspended proceedings for 90 minutes after Hanson refused to remove the burqa.
title: One Nation’s Hanson Suspended From Senate After Wearing Burqa in Chamber

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Lt. Gen. Eyal Zamir said that inquiries confirmed the IDF failed to protect civilians on Oct. 7, 2023.
title: Israeli Army Chief Removes Senior Commanders Over Oct. 7 Failures

author: AAP
description: One Nation leader Pauline Hanson has been labelled a “racist” and suspended from the Senate after wearing a burqa into the chamber. Shortly after Hanson failed to move a bill banning the Islamic head covering from public places on Monday, the 71-year-old entered the chamber wearing a burqa during a vote on a separate motion. […]
title: ‘Racist’: Hanson Condemned for Reprising Burqa Stunt

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: An attempt by one Australian council to cap the length of time homes can be used as tourist accommodation has actually led to fewer long-term rentals.
title: Damping Demand for Holiday Rentals Not the Silver Bullet for the Housing Crisis, Research Finds

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: An internal email urged MPs to shut down devices, disable Wi-Fi and Bluetooth, and keep laptops offline while the delegation moved through Parliament House.
title: MPs Told to Turn Off Phones, Devices During Parliamentary Visit by CCP No. 3

author: Aldgra Fredly
description: The recent referendum was triggered after opponents collected more than 40,000 signatures from people, calling for another vote.
title: Slovenians Reject Law That Legalizes Assisted Dying for Terminally Ill Patients

author: Daniel Y. Teng, Rex Widerstrom
description: Amid calls for US sanctions against Zhao Leji, a human rights lawyer says Australia also risks undermining its global reputation.
title: Barrister Urges Australia Not to Host CCP No. 3 Amid Organ Harvesting Concerns

author: Daniel Y. Teng, Rex Widerstrom
description: Amid calls for US sanctions against Zhao Leji, a human rights lawyer says Australia also risks undermining its global reputation.
title: CCP No. 3’s Australia Visit Comes Amid Ongoing Scrutiny of Organ Harvesting Activities

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The ATO will process $16 billion in cuts over the next two weeks.
title: $16 Billion Student Debt Reduced for 3 Million Australians, Fiscal Concerns Remain

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The Australian Bureau of Meteorology’s controversial website upgrade, initially costed at $4 million is now estimated at $96 million.
title: Minister Orders Culture Reset at BOM After Website Blowout Soars to $96 Million

author: The Associated Press
description: LONDON—A U.K. patrol ship has intercepted a Russian corvette and a tanker after shadowing them through the English Channel, the Defense Ministry said Sunday, adding that Russian naval activity around U.K. waters had increased by 30 percent over the past two years. With the past two weeks, the patrol ship HMS Severn intercepted the Russian […]
title: UK Navy Intercepts Russian Corvette and Tanker as Moscow Steps up Naval Activity

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: The former long-serving treasurer says most industrial awards are too complex, and the Productivity Commission is focused on anything but productivity.
title: Workplace Laws Too Confusing to Navigate for Well-Meaning Employers: Costello

author: Daniel Y. Teng, Rex Widerstrom
description: A former military and security officer says Beijing's spy network is pervasive with every possible opportunity being exploited.
title: 1,000 Spies for Every 10 From the West: Ex-Military Officer Lifts the Lid on CCP Spy Tactics

author: Reuters
description: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Sunday that Ukraine was grateful to the United States and to President Donald Trump for all U.S. efforts aimed at helping Kyiv. “Ukraine is thankful to the United States, to every American heart and particularly to President Trump for the help which, starting with Javelin (missiles), saves Ukrainian lives,” Zelenskyy […]
title: Zelenskyy Responds After Trump Says Ukraine Expressed ‘Zero Gratitude’

author: Riley Donovan
description: Commentary Britain’s dramatic, hard-nosed reforms to its asylum system demonstrate that civilized countries can put their citizens first without compromising on the essential Western values of dignity and fairness. At a time when Canada is rethinking our own immigration policies, we should meditate on Britain’s approach. On Nov. 17, British Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood delivered […]
title: Canada Should Emulate Britain’s Historic Refugee System Overhaul

author: The Canadian Press
description: Teams of British Columbia conservation officers rotated throughout the night to search for a grizzly bear responsible for attacking an elementary school group. An update from B.C. Conservation Officer Service on Sunday said the search around Bella Coola for the female and two young bears includes an RCMP aircraft with thermal imaging cameras. “We continue […]
title: Teams Work Through the Night in Search of Bear After BC Attack
